metadata.Title: CVE-2016-6131 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - low.
metadata.Description:
The demangler in GNU Libiberty allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (infinite loop, stack overflow, and crash) via a cycle in the references of remembered mangled types.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-6131` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

gdb - 7.7.1-0ubuntu5~14.04.3
gdb-minimal - 7.7.1-0ubuntu5~14.04.3
gdb-multiarch - 7.7.1-0ubuntu5~14.04.3
gdb-source - 7.7.1-0ubuntu5~14.04.3
gdb64 - 7.7.1-0ubuntu5~14.04.3
gdbserver - 7.7.1-0ubuntu5~14.04.3
No subscription required

valgrind - 1:3.10.1-1ubuntu3~14.5
No subscription required

criterions.comment: binutils package in trusty/esm is affected and may need fixing.
binutils-h8300-hms: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
gcc-h8300-hms: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
gdb package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '7.7.1-0ubuntu5~14.04.3').
ht: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
nescc: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
valgrind package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1:3.10.1-1ubuntu3~14.5').
